name: Philodendron Gloriosum
climate: Philodendron Gloriosum thrives in a tropical climate that mimics humid, warm environments.
Temperatures should ideally be between 18-25Â°C, avoiding cooler climates.
It is well-suited to indoor environments if humidity is adequately managed.
Avoid exposing the plant to cold drafts or sudden temperature changes.
sunlight: Prefers bright, indirect sunlight and can tolerate lower light conditions.
Direct sunlight may scorch the leaves; hence filtered light is ideal.
It's suitable for rooms with filtered natural light or artificial grow lights.
Avoid putting the plant where it would receive direct sunlight most of the day.
watering: Water the plant when the top inch of soil becomes dry to the touch.
Maintain consistent moisture, but avoid waterlogging the soil to prevent root rot.
During the growing season, water more frequently compared to the dormant phase.
Decreased watering is advisable in winter when the plant's growth rate slows.
soil: A well-draining soil mix with rich organic material is preferred for growth.
It benefits from soil mixtures containing peat, perlite, and orchid bark.
The soil should retain some moisture but also offer enough aeration for roots.
Ensure that the pot provides adequate drainage holes to prevent water accumulation.
toxic: Philodendron Gloriosum is toxic to pets and humans if ingested due to calcium oxalate crystals.
extra_care_tip: Regularly wipe the leaves to remove dust and support photosynthesis.
